tv.source-info-name: Pluto TV Space guide by TV

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Gravity
programme.desc: Gravity has long been a force that has intrigued scientists. Now, for the first time scientists are probing to detect gravity waves in space as well as mapping the gravity patterns of the moon.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Cold War & The Start of the Space Race - Cold War rivalry and the acceleration of space exploration. Servicing Hubble - Preparations for Hubble's final servicing mission. Chasing a Comet - Launch and the difficult path to rendezvous.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Mercury Begins - The start of NASA & America's first manned space program. Mars Express - The European Space Agency's Mars Satellite. The Soyuz Launch System - The gradual evolution of Russia's Soyuz launcher.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Mercury Advances - America's first manned space program finally puts a man in orbit. Camera Tracking - The array of special cameras that follow a spacecraft at launch. The International Space Station - The building and operation.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini Commences - Did Gemini give the US a lead in the space race? Venus Express - The last days of ESA's Venus probe. EMU - NASA's Extravehicular Mobility Unit. Deep Space Communications - ESA's worldwide network of giant dishes.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini Advances - NASA refines the techniques needed for rendezvous. Cassini at Saturn - In the Cassini probe's final years of activity, its handlers are asking it to do more complex and risky assignments.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini: Docking and EVA - In the final phase of the Gemini program NASA struggles with docking and spacewalks. Curiosity Roving Mars - On the surface of Mars the Curiosity rover is changing the way we think about the red planet.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: The Apollo Program Begins - At the very beginning of NASA's moon project things go wrong. Caves - ESA's special training program for astronauts. Planck - Mapping the cosmic microwave background radiation.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Rebuilding Project Apollo - After the Apollo 1 disaster NASA resumes manned space flight. Orbiting Carbon Observatory 2 - Monitoring the Earth's Co2 levels in unprecedented detail. Zero Gravity Training - Parabolic flights.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Beyond Earth Orbit - The Apollo program takes bold new steps. IXV Re-entry Vehicle - Europe is working to perfect a re-entry vehicle. Galileo Satellites Lost and Found - Navigation satellites go into incorrect orbit.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: To the Moon - The Apollo program achieves its major objective. Dragon, Falcon and Spacex - New directions in re-usable spacecraft. Gaia- Mapping our galaxy in unprecedented detail.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: The Beginning of the End - After the first Moon landing the Apollo science program was about to start in earnest but people were losing interest. Apollo Gets Complicated - New technology is added that extends the reach of the Apollo program.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: The Shuttle Program - The first re-useable spacecraft. The Challenger Disaster - Pressing launch schedules lead to carelessness and the loss of the Challenger. Return to Space - A re-designed shuttle is back in space with a redefined role.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: The Space Shuttle Matures - The Space Transportation System changes the nature of orbital missions. Complex Construction in Space - Confidence in the shuttle begins to return and engineers for get the lessons of the past.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: Brenham, Kansas
programme.desc: In Brenham, Kansas pieces of a large meteorite that fell thousands of years ago have been unearthed. Using advanced metal detection equipment Arnold and Notkin work tirelessly to find the meteorite pieces that have yet to be discovered.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: The Tucson Ring
programme.desc: In the 1850s a farmer came across a meteorite in Arizona; it's known as the "Tucson Ring" and now resides at the Smithsonian. Arnold and Notkin search for more pieces in an attempt to solve one of the biggest mysteries in the world of meteorite hunters.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: The Odessa Iron Meteorite
programme.desc: Approximately 50,000 years ago a giant meteor created one of only two craters in the U.S. that have produced meteorite specimens. In this episode, Steve and Geoff will be hunting on the land surrounding the crater with their new cutting-edge detectors.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: West, Texas
programme.desc: Ash Creek is the site of the most recent recorded meteorite fall in United States (February 15, 2009). In this episode, Geoff and Steve will follow clues provided by the locals to uncover the mysterious rocks of this fall.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: Gold Basin
programme.desc: In 1995, Professor Jim Kriegh discovered a field of of ancient stone meteorites; the Gold Basin Meteorite is known as the best mapped strewn field in history. In this episode, Geoff and Steve get exclusive access to hunt meteorites in uncharted areas.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: Buzzard Coulee & Whitecourt Crater
programme.desc: In Canada, Geoff and search for pieces of the Buzzard Coulee Meteorite. Also, the meteorite hunters receive a surprise invitation to visit the newly discovered, and highly protected, Whitecourt Crater and hunt the surrounding area.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: Dry Lake Bed
programme.desc: Dry lake beds are a great place to find never before discovered meteorites. In this episode, the terrain of the bed provides spectacular visuals and high-speed action as Geoff and Steve cover as much ground as possible, looking for dark rocks.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: Kansas: Return To Alpha
programme.desc: Geoff and Steve return to their confidential "Alpha" site. During a research and development visit to Orange County Choppers, they help plan a meteorite hunting motorcycle, which is delivered to them by American Chopper star Paul Senior.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: Chile 1: Imilac & Vaca Muerta
programme.desc: In the first-ever overseas Meteorite Men episode Steve and Geoff revisit the very site where their hunting partnership began way back in 1997: the Imilac pallasite strewnfield high in Chile's Atacama Desert.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: Chile 2: Monturaqui Crater & San Juan
programme.desc: Geoff's "meteorite dream" comes true during this second Chile episode when the guys find their way to the Atacama Desert's remote Monturaqui Crater, and camp overnight on the floor of the stunning 100,000 year-old impact site.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: Brenham, Kansas
programme.desc: In Brenham, Kansas pieces of a large meteorite that fell thousands of years ago have been unearthed. Using advanced metal detection equipment Arnold and Notkin work tirelessly to find the meteorite pieces that have yet to be discovered.
